alert.note: Alert for Box Butte; Dawes; North Sioux; South Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 29 at 4:04AM CST until January 30 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snowfall accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Wind chill temperatures of 20 to 30 below zero are expected Sunday night into early Monday. * WHERE...The northern Nebraska Panhandle including Sioux, Dawes, and Box Butte Counties. This includes the cities of Harrison, Chadron, Alliance. The highest totals will be found along the Pine Ridge. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions due to icy, snow packed roads and reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in less than 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Use caution outdoors. When outside, be sure to wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Box Butte; Dawes; North Sioux; South Sioux
